thread.title: Hayden Panettiere enters treatment for postpartum depression
thread.title_full: Hayden Panettiere enters treatment for postpartum depression | Fox News

author: FoxNews.com
title: Hayden Panettiere enters treatment for postpartum depression
text:
Published October 14, 2015 FoxNews.com Facebook 0 Twitter 0 Email Print In this Nov. 23, 2015 file photo, actress Hayden Panettiere attends Jony & Marc's (Red) Auction at Sotheby's New York to benefit The Global Fund to fight AIDS, in New York. A spokeswoman for the actress says in a statement the "Nashville" star is voluntarily seeking professional help at a treatment center while battling postpartum depression. The 26-year-old actress gave birth to her daughter in December 2014. (AP)
Hayden Panettiere is entering treatment for postpartum depression.
A spokeswoman for the actress says in a statement that the "Nashville" star is voluntarily seeking professional help at a treatment center while battling postpartum depression. She asked that the media respect her privacy during this time.
Panettiere gave birth to her daughter in December. It's the first child for the 26-year-old actress and 39-year-old professional boxer Wladimir Klitschko.
The new mom opened up about her struggle on "Live with Kelly and Michael" in September.
"When [you’re told] about postpartum depression you think it’s ‘I feel negative feelings towards my child, I want to injure or hurt my child,' I've never, ever had those feelings. Some women do. But you don't realize how broad of a spectrum you can really experience that on...It's something that needs to be talked about. Women need to know that they’re not alone, and that it does heal."
Notably, Panettiere's character on "Nashville," Juliette Barnes, has experienced postpartum depression.
The actress also starred in the NBC series "Heroes" and the film "Scream 4."
The Associated Press contributed to this report.
